intro: Spergula arvensis subsp. chieusseana, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in fields, and is adapted to temperate climates. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in various habitats.
